one_liner: This technique classifies types of crime using narrative text extracted from court documents.
how_it_works: The technique involves extracting narrative sections from public court documents, particularly those containing police report excerpts. After preprocessing the text data, it is labeled according to crime types. A machine learning model is then trained on this labeled dataset to classify new documents based on their narratives.

steps: 2. Extract narrative sections that likely contain police report excerpts.
3. Preprocess the text data (cleaning, tokenization, etc.).
4. Label the data based on crime types.
5. Train a machine learning model on the labeled dataset.
6. Evaluate the model's performance on a test set.
7. Use the model for classifying new court documents.
algorithm.input_format: Public court documents containing narrative text.
algorithm.output_format: Classified crime types for each document.
